Description: Carved panel; cedarwood; from a door; oblong; the Baptism; a bearded Christ with cruciferous nimbus, stands up to the waist in the river Jordan; to his right stands St John the Baptist in a garment of skins with his right hand extended over Christ's head, and a long cross in his left; above is the dove and to the left three angels holding garments.
Curator's comments: On the el-Muʿallaqah church and it furnishing: E. Maglaque, "Devotional and Artistic Responses to Contested Space in Old Cairo: The Case of Al-Mu’allakah", in: M. Gharipour, ed. Sacred Precincts: Non-Muslim Sites in Islamic Societies (Leiden 2014) 143-57; M. Immerzeel, The Narrow Way to Heaven: Identity and Identities in the Art of Middle Eastern Christianity (Louvain 2017) 69-76.
Bibliographic references: Dalton 1901 / Catalogue of Early Christian Antiquities and Objects from the Christian East in the Department of British and Medieval Antiquities and Ethnography of the British Museum (986)
Effenberger and von Falck 1996 / Ägypten, Schätze aus dem Wüstensand: Kunst und Kultur der Christen am Nil (no.102b, p.140)
Paris 2000 / L'art copte en Égypte 2000 ans de christianisme: Exposition présentée à l’Institut du monde arabe, Paris (no.184, p.176)
Hunt 1989 / The al-Muʿallaqa Doors Reconstructed: An Early Fourteenth-Century Sanctuary Screen from Old Cairo
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2015, Oct 29 – 2016, Feb 7. British Museum, Room 35. Egypt: Faith after the Pharoahs 2008-2009 25 Oct-22 Mar, London, Royal Academy of Arts, Byzantium 330-1453 AD 2004 15 Mar-5 Jul, USA, New York, Metropolitan Museum of Art, Byzantium; Faith and Power 2000 30 Sep-2001 7 Jan, France, La Clape, Musée de l’Ephebe, L’art copte en Egypte 2000 15 May-3 Sep, France, Paris, Institut du Monde Arabe, Coptic Art 1997 20 Mar-13 Jul, Germany, Munich, Staatliche Sammlung Agyptischer Kunst, Agypten: Schätze aus dem Wüstensand - Kunst und Kultur der Christen am Nil 1996 24 Nov-1997 23 Feb, Germany, Mainz, Landesmuseum Mainz, Agypten - Schatze aus dem Wustensand: Kunst und Kultur der Christen am Nil 1996 15 Jun-13 Oct, Germany, Hamm, Gustav Lübcke Museum, Agypten: Schatze aus dem Wustensand - Kunst und Kultur der Christem am Nil
Associated names: Representation of: St John the Baptist (Prodromos)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Charles H A Schefer
